abstract: The search giant posted record-breaking quarterly revenue of $10.58 billion. But Wall Street had expected Google to post a higher income figure, sending shares lower in after-hours trading.
snippet: The search giant posted record-breaking quarterly revenue of $10.58 billion. But Wall Street had expected Google to post a higher income figure, sending shares lower in after-hours trading.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Larry Page, Google’s chief executive and co-founder, celebrated the first anniversary of the announcement that he would take over the company with the news Thursday that it had exceeded $10 billion in quarterly revenue for the first time.

headline.main: Google’s Results Disappoint, Sending Shares Down
headline.print_headline: Google’s Fourth-Quarter Results Disappoint, Sending Its Shares Lower
